update.description:
The camera follow feature defaults to following an entity in the entity’s local frame. This PR adds an additional `<world_frame>` parameter to fix the camera orientation and position wrt the entity it’s following.

This is useful for example when following a box that rolls down a hill. With the default frame configuration, the camera rolls around the box when in follow mode. We previously worked around that issue by setting `<p_gain>` to 0, see [here](#!/ignitionrobotics/ign-gazebo/pull-requests/430/add-follow-mode-to-gui/diff#comment-117102773), but it’s not ideal since it affects the speed of camera movement and eventually the camera would not be able to follow the object.

Here’s the behavior of of running the `rolling_shapes.sdf` world with `<p_gain>` of 0.05:

`world_frame: false`

![](https://bitbucket.org/repo/8zodKzn/images/1435634590-camera_follow_local.gif)
‌

`world_frame: true`

![](https://bitbucket.org/repo/8zodKzn/images/451263956-camera_follow_world.gif)
‌

Update: [25b2507](#!/ignitionrobotics/ign-gazebo/commits/25b2507ea7bca2bbab405b9c6a7b13a36f6b1b05): Also added support for configuring the camera follow offset position
update.title: Support camera follow in world frame
